Replies.Reply: During his monologue, each time Criswell looks up at the camera a DRAMATIC PAUSE is inserted as he then looks back down at the cue card and searches for his place in order to continue.
It is said on clear nights, beneath	the cold light of the moon, howl the dog and the wolf, and creeping things crawl out of the slime.  It is then the ghouls feast in all their radiance.
Come forth, come forth, o Princess of Darkness.
Time seems to stand still.  Not so the ghouls, when a night of Pleasure is at hand!
If I am not pleased by tonight's entertainment, I shall banish their souls to everlasting damnation!
And who is to be first?
I would see for approval, the one who in life worshipped gold above all else.
Throw gold at her.
More gold.
More gold!
More gold!
For all eternity, she shall have gold.
Bring 'em in!
They are live ones?
Live ones where only the dead should be?
You shall both be rewarded.
My Dear Empress of the Night, put these intruders to the test.
A situation easily remedied.
A pussycat is born to be whipped.
It will please me very much to see the Slave Girl with her tortures!
Torture! Torture!  It pleasures me!
HOLD!
Let her continue to learn. The time is not yet right that they should join with us.
What kind of symbol?
She came to us on the Day of the Dead.
She was?
Oh, yes, a religion of sorts.
She pleases me.  Permit her to live in the World of the Snakes.
Of course you are.
You know better than that.
Then why do you shake so?
Well rest easy, I'm not angry with either of you.
You are the keepers of the Damned.  You two know them all. And I am tired of this usual type of entertainment.
Yes, yes yes I know all that.
I suppose most of the others will have to wait for their judgement until after the next full moon.
Ahh, but I declare there is still time for something.
Ahh, good.  Then I will see them.  Dismiss the rest.
Not yet.  I perhaps have other plans for such a pretty one. No matter, I will tell you when and if you may have her.
Have you not enjoyed the evening's festivities?
Ahh, that will soon change when you become one of us!
It would seem that The Wolf Man would have you for his own!
I have promised both The Wolf Man and The Mummy a reward.  It could be that you are that reward.
And you, my dear, will entertain for centuries to come.
..Oh, You could do nothing!
I can save you much pain.
I do not joke in my proposal.
The Princess of Darkness would have you for her own to join us through extreme pain.
I repulse you?  Very well.  It seems you have chosen your own fate. Live with it!  I should say die with it!
Ahh, she will be yours.
Ahh, there is yet time.
I know the laws of the night. I state there is still time for yet another.

Your own pleasure comes only after mine, when I desire it. I am the Sole Ruler of the Dark World.  There is no one to challenge my authority here. My word is the law--all powerful. No one is to challenge that authority, no one!.  Is that understood?  It is my command.
Then see that it does not happen again, in the penalty of Everlasting Despair.  Now are there others?
Well then let us proceed.
I will decide the conclusion.
Then cancel my order.
There is yet time.  Don't you want your own pleasure?
Your pleasures of course!
You may take her now.
You better hope there is.
TITLES are superimposed over a still photo of a Gilded Nude Female Figure sitting on the stone altar in the MAUSOLEUM.
L.S. JENSEN NEIL B. STEIN    Produced and Directed by A. C. STEPHEN    FADE TO BLACK.
We sure picked the wrong night to find a cemetery.  Let's turn back.
But does it have to be in a cemetery?
But there're so many wonderful things to write about, Bob.
But horror stories!  Why all the time horror stories?
That's life.  My kisses are alive.
Well, fact or not, I don't see how we're going to find an ancient cemetery in these mountains tonight.  I can't see a thing!  Let's turn back.
I'm getting the jitters! Let's turn back!
Not so fast!
Not so fast!
I'm so frightened.
Where?
It frightens me.
Then..then what's that music?
What help can we possibly find in the cemetery at this time of night?
I'm not sure I care to find out what it is.
What help will that do if something in there isn't dead?
I can't imagine anything dead playing that music.
Could it be some kind of college initiation?
Can't we get out of here?
What do you mean?
Look!
Fiend!  Fiend!
I'm so frightened.
Those creatures..!
What can we do?
I'm afraid I'll faint.
Be careful!
Nothing is worth your life.
I'm frightened.  I'm so frightened.
Be careful, oh please be careful.  We'll never get out of here alive, I know it.  I just feel it.
Yes I feel it in my bones.
Oh, no I'm not.  These heathens probably have an open grave for us.
I should hope not.  I hate you!
Yes, that sudden.  If it weren't for you we wouldn't be hunting for an old cemetery on a night like this.  It's all your fault.
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA.
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA.
No. No! No!
What can we do against them?
I still don't know what ever made me go steady with a crackpot writer like you.
My old boyfriend Tommy would never have gotten me in a mess like this.  At least he's got brains.
Maybe so.
Bob?  Bob?
Where are they, where did they go? They tried to kill me.
The ghouls--they all turned into skeletons.
It's true, I tell you, it's true!  They all turned into skeletons.  She-she cut me here.
I love you Bob. I really do. Forgive me?
You love me then?
No.  It's on a night like this when the best ideas come to mind.
You wouldn't understand.  Seeing a cemetery on a night like this can stir in the mind the best ideas for a good horror story.
Sure there are--and I've tried them all.  Plays, love stories, westerns, dog stories.  Huh, now there was a good one, that dog story all about--
Shirley, I wrote for years without selling a single word.

My monsters have done well for me.  You think I'd give that up just so I could write about trees, or dogs, or daisies? Huhuh--Daisies!  That's it, I'll write about my creatures who are pushing up the daisies.
Your puritan upbringing holds you back from my monsters, but it certainly doesn't hurt your art of kissing.
All of my books are based on fact, or legend.  Thats perhaps why they're more interesting and sell in the top spots.
There's an old cemetery on this road. I've been there before.
Okay.
Just as soon as I find a place wide enough to turn around.
In there.
Silly, there's nothing in there to be afraid of.
That's what I want to find out. We have to get help.
Something's making that music.
All right.  Don't worry, I'll be right beside you.
Not dead?  In a cemetery?
Well, it's probably just the caretaker, and that's exactly who we want to find.  They'll have a telephone.  C'mon.
It's an initiation all right, but not of a college as you and I know them.  Nothing alive looks like that!
Be careful!--They'll see you.
You've got a right to be. We're trapped by a bunch of fiends.
Don't let them hear you.
I don't know.  I just don't know. But don't give up. We're not finished yet.
Easy Shirley, Easy!  Panic won't do us any good!  Let me think. We've got to stall for time.
Whatever you do, don't do that.
The ropes are coming loose.
I am--It's our only chance.
My guess is if we don't take the chance pretty soon, we're not going to have much life left anyway.
Hold on just a little longer, Shirley.
You do?
You're talking nonsense.
They wouldn't dare put us in the same grave--
That sudden?
Leave her alone, you fiend!
Leave her alone, I tell you!
I've got the ropes loose now. I've got my hands free.  Be careful--Don't change your expression too much.  They must not catch on.
I don't know, yet.  We'll just have to watch our chance. When it comes I'll know what to do--I hope I'll know what to do.
All right.  Put it on heavy.
Him!  I'll bet he sleeps with all the lights on.
Easy, Shirley.  Easy!
There's nothing to forgive. It was all a dream.
Of course I do.
One who loved flames.  Her lover was killed by flames.  She died in flames.
One who prowls the lonely streets at night in life is bound to prowl them in eternity.
But they are not yet one of us.
Tie them that they may watch.
To love the cat, is to be the cat!
A symbol, Master.
She loved the bull ring and the matador.  She danced to their destruction.
With the loss of her lover, this one cast herself into the Volcano's fire.
As I said, a worshipper of snakes, and of smoke, and flames.
It would seem so, Master.
As you wish, Master  The Princess of Darkness motions for The Wolf Man and The Mummy to come.
COME!
There is little time left for the remainder of the evening's pleasures.
At the first sight of the morning sun's rays, we must be gone.
The Wolf Man informs me that the next one is the woman who murdered her husband on their wedding night.  Now she dances with his skeleton.
She is to be mine!  It is so spoken!
Well?
When!?
The moon is almost gone!
I would have time for my own pleasures!
There are others.
She lived as a zombie in life, so she will remain forever a zombie in death.
The moon sinks lower into the hills!  We must hurry to the finish.
You had the mummy cancel all the others scheduled for this session.
The moon is almost gone!
Oh, if there is only time!
For what!?!
Is there time?
Thank you, Master!  Thank you.
Yes, Master.
Yes, Master, and we caught them, him and me.

I don't like snakes.  I remember the one Cleopatra used.  Cute little rascal until it flicked out that red tongue, and those two sharp fangs.  You'd never think such a little thing packed such a big wallop.
Hurt her?  Hell, it killed her!
When I was alive, they were the things nightmares were made of.
What do you suppose for?
Did you do something to get us into trouble again?
Did you howl off-key at the moon again?
I can't remember doing anything wrong either.
We better go before we make him mad.
We are your servants, Master.
Have we in some way made you angry, Master?
It's not often an Emperor like you calls on creatures like us.
Aaaahhhh.
Then it is some service you desire of us.
Yes, sir, Master.
WWWWOOOOOOAAAAAAAUUUUUGGGGHHHHAHAAAA!!!
Aaaaahhnnnhaaaaaannnhhh?
Aahhhhnnnaaahahnn.
Aaarrrgggaahh.
Aaahhnnnahnnnn.
Aaaaannnnnuuunnnuhhhhh?
Aannnnaahhnn.
Aannnnaahhnn.
Ahh hahahhnnn hahnnn!
AAAAAAAAAHHGGGGGHHHHHHHhhhhhh!
